name: Ludwig van Beethoven
description: German composer, pivotal in classical to romantic transition, masterpieces include 'Moonlight Sonata' and 'Symphony No. 9'.

name: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
description: Austrian composer, prodigious and influential in the classical era, works include 'The Magic Flute' and 'Requiem'.

name: Johann Sebastian Bach
description: German Baroque composer, known for 'Brandenburg Concertos', 'Mass in B minor', and 'The Well-Tempered Clavier'.

name: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky
description: Russian composer, known for 'Swan Lake', 'The Nutcracker', and '1812 Overture', blending Russian and European styles.

name: Frédéric Chopin
description: Polish composer and virtuoso pianist, primarily a solo piano composer, known for 'Nocturnes' and 'Preludes'.

name: Franz Schubert
description: Austrian composer, known for his lieder, symphonies, and chamber music, including 'Winterreise' and 'Unfinished Symphony'.

name: Antonio Vivaldi
description: Italian Baroque composer, violinist, known for 'The Four Seasons' and numerous concertos, influential in Baroque music.

name: George Frideric Handel
description: German-British Baroque composer, known for 'Messiah', 'Water Music', and 'Music for the Royal Fireworks'.

name: Igor Stravinsky
description: Russian-born composer, pivotal in 20th-century music, known for 'The Rite of Spring' and 'The Firebird'.

name: Johannes Brahms
description: German composer and pianist, leading musician of the Romantic era, known for 'A German Requiem' and 'Hungarian Dances'.
